-e ---

Bronzen alloys developed slowly and gradually by first selecting harder copper, then by (sub)conciously adding arsene and finnaly by adding tin. We suggest that this development is responsible for linguistic connections between old words for copper and tin.

𒍐 tu₃ tin

𒀭 ⲑⲣⲁ •DRAᵒⁿ 𓇳 sundra ⇔ 𒀭 starn 𓇼
𒀭𒈾 ⲑⲣⲁⲛ tin ⇔ stern tran? 𒀭𒈾 ᴰna tina “tin” < ⲑⲣⲁⲛ! ⇔ DINGIR dinar :

𒈊 dinigʳ ≈ DINGIR 𒀭𒈾 ⲑⲣⲁⲛ tin kiln furnace 𒈊 dinigʳ 𐎚𐎐𐎐𐎗 tannūrᵍ tannour <> 𒁾𒉄 tabira 𒋼𒁉𒊒 te-bi-ru /tebīruⁿ/ Töpfer դարբին darbin smith 𒈊 dinigʳ ≈ 𒅎𒇌 duruna₂ 𒅎𒋾𒉡𒌨 ti-nu-ur #tinûru tannour ∋ tin

𒀭𒈾𒆪 an-na-ku ≠ Nickel
𒀭𒈾𒆪 lead, tin

Thankfully these metals are also linked to the symbols 𓏣⋍𓋹 and 𒋾 since ancient times.

DinGir Stern:stanna 𒀭𒈾 anna ón

There seems to be a persistent connection to the Divine twins and diwós god him/herself.

♀♀ The Janus/Venus duality comes from the important discovery that morning star and evening star are actually aspects of the same star.

♀ 单 DON dān Devane Ivonne Venus water/river goddess of copper/tin
♀ 单 Ister (Donau) Ištar / goddess of metallurgy…

Gir ⇔ chrome калај kalaj chalco ≠ clay

Tin and copper have to be investigated together, as silver and gold.

金 ⇔ Zinke Zahn cone

Tin was more valuable than gold in the Bronze age.
